selected_quotes: The global prevalence of common mental disorders
Paper Monbiot cites ( on mental disorders shows a fall in prevalence between 1990s and 2000s
1 in 5 experienced common mental disorder in past 12 months 1 in 4 across their lifetime #mentalhealth
#SystematicReview: Global prevalence of common mental disorders #mentalhealth #evaluation @GMentalHealth

citation.abstract: Since the introduction of specified diagnostic criteria for mental disorders in the 1970s, there has been a rapid expansion in the number of large-scale mental health surveys providing population estimates of the combined prevalence of common mental disorders (most commonly involving mood, anxiety and substance use disorders). In this study we undertake a systematic review and meta-analysis of this literature.
citation.title: The global prevalence of common mental disorders: a systematic review and meta-analysis 1980–2013

news.title: Google Life Sciences just hired the government's top mental illness expert
news.summary: Sep. 15, 2015, 12:25 PM 1,697 Google's Life Sciences team is growing quickly, now that it's part of the Alphabet family.

news.title: Experts Say These Are The People Most Likely To Suffer From Anxiety
news.summary: Anxiety disorders like social anxiety disorder, obsessive compulsive disorder, agoraphobia, panic disorder and general anxiety are the most common forms of mental illness in the U.S.

news.title: Neoliberalism is creating loneliness. That’s what’s wrenching society apart | George Monbiot
news.summary: What greater indictment of a system could there be than an epidemic of mental illness? Yet plagues of anxiety, stress, depression, social phobia, eating disorders, self-harm and loneliness now strike people down all over the world.

news.title: Amish Asthma Rates Offer Clues to Preventing Mental Illness
news.summary: Why asthma rates may hold the key to improving mental healt h About 20 miles southeast of South Bend Indiana, straddling US highway 6, lies the farming village of Nappanee Indiana, population 6,692.

news.title: Bajo su superficie alegre, Latinoamérica también sufre de depresión
news.summary: Desde el exterior, la sociedad latinoamericana se ve alegre, sonriente y trabajadora, incluso durante tiempos difíciles.

news.title: How Probiotics Can Be Good for Your Brain

news.title: Does sugar make you sad? New science suggests so
news.summary: The thought of a cupcake, skillfully frosted with fluffy vanilla icing, may put a smile on your face, but research suggests that, in the long term, a sweet tooth may turn that smile into a frown – but not for the reasons you think.
